title: Big Country Abilene Outdoor Adventure Day held at Grover Nelson Park
content: ABILENE, Texas —   On Saturday, local families gathered at Grover Nelson Park in Abilene for Abilene Outdoor Adventure Day.    The third annual collaborative community event was the chance for kids and families to find ways to get involved with the outdoors in the Big Country, with children participating in various outdoor activities such as dry land kayaking, fishing and archery.    “It’s a well-rounded activity just to show people how people can get involved in the outdoors, build family bonds and get more conservation-minded,” said Michael Homer, the Inland Fisheries Abilene District Supervisor. “That's extremely important, especially now since we are going into a drought and the more you know [about the outdoors], the more we are going to care about it."    The event took place from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturday.
